summary: This is a May 21, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, producing discovery materials including Interlochen records and native 'carved' images from numerous electronic devices. The letter is designated as confidential under a protective order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

persons.name: Audrey Strauss

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces discovery materials, including Interlochen records and native 'carved' images from electronic devices, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the confidentiality of discovery materials, as referenced in the letter.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced a significant batch of discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on May 21, 2021.
The production included 'Interlochen records,' which may refer to documents or communications related to the Interlochen Center for the Arts.
The production included numerous 'native carved images' from over 20 different electronic devices (e.g., NYCO24321, NYCO24323), indicating extensive forensic data extraction.
All produced materials and the cover letter itself are designated as 'confidential' under a July 31, 2020 protective order.
The case is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN), indicating it is a 2020 criminal case.
